name: Charting queer connections
description: The infamous ‘Incest Map’ in Heartbreak High charts connections between Hartley High students, instigating the drama that unfolds in the series. Explore this fictional map’s connections to lesbian media that has been integral to building lesbian community and culture.

start.title: Kweens of the Queer Underground
start.brief_description: Three queer stories. Three queer filmmakers. Three journeys into the queer underground, to celebrate WorldPride 2023.

end.title: Ahead of the Curve
end.creator_credit: Jen Rainin, Rivkah Beth Medow and Jessica Congdon

video_links.name: AHEAD OF THE CURVE // Official Trailer

end.brief_description: With a fist full of credit cards, a lucky run at the horse track, and a title that called to mind a certain French film star, Franco Stevens launched the best-selling lesbian lifestyle magazine ever published, connecting her community in an unprecedented way. AHEAD OF THE CURVE is a new feature documentary about the extraordinary woman who started Curve magazine, and by doing so helped accelerate the political and social evolution of the nation.

constellations_other.name: Charting queer connections
constellations_other.description: The infamous ‘Incest Map’ in Heartbreak High charts connections between Hartley High students, instigating the drama that unfolds in the series. Explore this fictional map’s connections to lesbian media that has been integral to building lesbian community and culture.

links.description: Both Kweens of the Queer Underground and Ahead of the Curve document the creation and history of lesbian magazines, highlighting their importance in building community and celebrating lesbian culture. Both publications merged when they were sold from their original owners to Silke Bader.

constellations_other.name: Charting queer connections
constellations_other.description: The infamous ‘Incest Map’ in Heartbreak High charts connections between Hartley High students, instigating the drama that unfolds in the series. Explore this fictional map’s connections to lesbian media that has been integral to building lesbian community and culture.

links.description: In addition to co-directing Cool 2B Queer, Tilly Robba co-directed episode 3 of Kweens of the Underground that centred on the history and significance of the monthly Australian lesbian magazine Lesbians on the Loose (LOTL) since the 1990s.

links.description: The map that appears in Heartbreak High was created by musician Chela and filmmaker Tilly Robba, who also worked together to co-direct Chela’s camp music video “Cool 2B Queer”.

start.title: The L Word
start.creator_credit: Angela Robinson, Cherien Dabis, Ilene Chaiken, Rose Troche and Coast Mountain Films Studios
start.brief_description: A group of lesbian friends struggle with romance and careers in Los Angeles.

constellations_other.name: Charting queer connections
constellations_other.description: The infamous ‘Incest Map’ in Heartbreak High charts connections between Hartley High students, instigating the drama that unfolds in the series. Explore this fictional map’s connections to lesbian media that has been integral to building lesbian community and culture.

end.title: Go fish
end.creator_credit: Rose Troche, Guinevere Turner, Can I Watch Pictures, Islet and KVPI
end.brief_description: Shot in black and white, on a low budget and using a predominantly non-professional cast, Rose Troche’s first feature offers an inside view of lesbian life in the ‘90’s. Max is looking for love, Ely suffers from a long distance relationship and their scheming friends are determined to match them. Navigated by a wistful narration, the film tracks the inter-linked cast of characters from cafes and bookshops to dinner parties, dates and sex. Starring Guinevere Turner, V. S. Brodie, T. Wendy McMillan, Migdalia Melendez and Anastasia Sharp. Screenplay by Rose Troche and Guinevere Turner.

constellations_other.name: Charting queer connections
constellations_other.description: The infamous ‘Incest Map’ in Heartbreak High charts connections between Hartley High students, instigating the drama that unfolds in the series. Explore this fictional map’s connections to lesbian media that has been integral to building lesbian community and culture.

links.description: The Chart in The L Word was based on the writers – including Rose Troche and Guinevere Turner – discussing the real-life romantic connections in their community. Troche and Turner first worked together on the film Go Fish.

links.description: The pilot of The L Word introduces audiences to The Chart: a strikingly similar map to the one featured in Heartbreak High that documents the love, connections and heartbreaks of the lesbian community in LA.
